primary.context: Caller wants to get rid of their timeshare
primary.detail: The caller requested a representative for an out-of-scope request; the transfer failed due to queue unavailability and the caller eventually hung up.

steps: Agent attempted to collect name and intent before transferring.
Caller stated they want to sell their ownership entirely.
Agent entered a loop asking if they want to rent it out instead.
Agent initiated transfer to concierge queue.
After a 25-minute hold, the system announced no agents were available.
Caller refused AI help and disconnected.

failure.detail: Agent repeatedly asked if the caller wanted to rent their week after the caller explicitly stated they wanted to sell ownership entirely.

corrections.note: Caller corrected agent's suggestion to rent
Caller again denied wanting to rent

loops.subject: renting vs selling
loops.note: Agent kept suggesting rental despite caller's refusal

actions.detail: Transferred to concierge; queue timed out after 25 minutes

insights.summary: The caller wanted to sell their timeshare and requested a representative immediately. After a repetitive loop where the AI kept suggesting rental options, the caller was placed in a queue for 25 minutes only to be told no agents were available.
insights.coaching: The agent should have recognized the 'sell ownership' intent as out-of-scope immediately and proceeded with the requested transfer rather than looping on rental questions the caller had already answered.
